alert.note: Alert for DeKalb (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 10:25PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of DeKalb County through 1100 PM CDT... At 1024 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles east of Ider to near Sylvania to near Sand Rock. Movement of the line was to the southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 30 to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fort Payne, Rainsville, Henagar, Sylvania, Fyffe, Powell, Ider, Valley Head, Hammondville and Mentone. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for northeastern Alabama.
